Hi,

Not quite sure on your question, but I would check the regular expression,
.*(?i)\.(doc|ppt)$, not sure why you have two slashes.

Let me know if this helps.

Manav

Artem Antonov <antonov.artem@...> wrote:                                  Hi,  
   
 Thanks a lot for help.  
 I've added ContentTypeRegExFilter to the 'midfetch-filter' and  
 'write-processors' sections, and now only html/text contents are  
 saved into the ARC file.  
   
 The one problem I couldn't solve is to accept only URIs that end  
 with the specified pattern (for example, ".doc, *.ppt").  
   
 I use 'org.archive.crawler.deciderules.DecidingScope' in Crawl Scope  
 to determine whether a URI is accepted or rejected. So, in 'scope'  
 section I've added:  
   
 <newObject name="filePattern"  
 class="org.archive.crawler.deciderules.MatchesFilePatternDecideRule">  
    <string name="decision">ACCEPT</string>  
    <string name="use-preset-pattern">Custom</string>  
    <string name="regexp">.*(?i)(\\.(doc|ppt))$</string>  
 </newObject>  
   
 But in 'crawl.log' file are saved all URIs from fetched documents.  
 How to extract only URIs that match the regexp?  
   
 Thanks.  
   
 Regards,  
 Artem.  
   
   
   
   
   
 --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "manavx81" <manavx81@...>  
 wrote:  
 >  
 > Hi,  
 >   
 > I found this blog very helpful:  
 > http://www.dreamersrealm.net/~tree/blog/?s=text%2Fhtml&submit=GO,  
 when  
 > trying to implemnt a job which would ignore sending requests for  
 uri's  
 > ending with certain file formats and also to look at response  
 header  
 > for content-type and decide whether to fetch the body or not.  
 >   
 > Manav  
 >   
 > --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "Artem Antonov"  
 > <antonov.artem@> wrote:  
 > >  
 > > Hello,        
 > >            
 > > I use Heritrix 1.10.1.           
 > > How I can set the regular expression to specify which file types  
 to  
 >           
 > > fetch (for example, only "txt" and "html" files)?        
 > >           
 > > The questions are:        
 > >         
 > > 1) In which section I should define a RegExp:          
 > > - tab "Submodules" in Web console -> "pre-fetch-processors"  
 section  
 >          
 > > -> Preselector -> <myFilter>, OR          
 > > - tab "Submodules" in Web console -> "fetch-processors" section  
 ->   
 >         
 > > HTML -> <myFilter> ?          
 > >           
 > > 2) All of types org.archive.crawler.filter.* are Deprecated, so  
 I    
 >        
 > > should use org.archive.crawler.deciderules.DecidingFilter type,  
 and  
 >          
 > > define my decide-rules (for example,          
 > > org.archive.crawler.deciderules.MatchesRegExpDecideRule)?   
 > >         
 > > 3) There is a section in order.xml file:       
 > >        
 > > <newObject name="Preselector"      
 > > class="org.archive.crawler.prefetch.Preselector">       
 > >  <boolean name="enabled">true</boolean>       
 > >  <map name="filters">       
 > >  </map>       
 > >  <boolean name="override-logger">false</boolean>       
 > >  <boolean name="recheck-scope">true</boolean>       
 > >  <boolean name="block-all">false</boolean>       
 > >  <string name="block-by-regexp"></string>       
 > >  <string name="allow-by-regexp"></string>       
 > > </newObject>       
 > >       
 > > So, what do mean these lines:      
 > >  <string name="block-by-regexp"></string>       
 > >  <string name="allow-by-regexp"></string>       
 > >       
 > > Can I define here a RegExp to restrict files types to fetch?    
 > >     
 > > Thanks in advance.        
 > >         
 > > Regards,        
 > > Artem Antonov.
